titre_produit: T√©l√©phone Portable Debloqu√© Ulefone Note 13P, Cam√©ra Arri√®re 20MP, Cam√©ra Frontale 16MP, G35 2,3GHz 4Go+64Go, Smartphone Dual SIM 4G, Ecran FHD+ 6,5 '', Fente pour 3 Cartes, Android 11, NFC Bleu
avis_text: after a few hours of transferring over the setup (apps etc) from my old phone (cubot x30) to the ulefone note 13, i took it for a run through its paces.performance wise i think it's pretty decent and fairly snappy. however, the display seemed completely off in terms of the colour accuracy. i don't think it can render red - every red tone was displayed as vibrant/burnt orange. i compared the screen to my cubot and it seemed completely washed out and devoid of any contrast or colour depth.i next tried the cameras. these are abysmal, absolutely abysmal. phones from nearly a decade ago deliver better pictures. the main reason for buying the ulefone over others was that it has sony image sensors. as a well trusted/established brand known for their reasonably good quality lenses and sensors, i was expected much more than the mushy undefined poor quality images that the camera produces.it's almost as if someone has smeared vaseline over the lens - no definition, lots of noise in the image, abysmal colour saturation and depth, absolutely horrible.just to qualify my reference points, my cubot x30 is significantly better (just being replaced as it's a bit unreliable now) and prior to that i've had phones in the ¬£80-¬£150 price range from cubot, xiaomi, and oukitel etc. going back through photo's i'd taken 8 years prior, it was clear that despite having a higher pixel count and also being so much newer, the quality of image and screen is shockingly poor and worse than products nearly a decade older!i transferred the images to my laptop so i could ensure it wasn't just a case of the shockingly bad display screen with wildly inaccurate colour rendering that was the issue, and no - it wasn't, it's clearly the camera/lens/sensor. i've tried various different settings from decreasing the pixel count to applying filters, invoking the ai capability of the photo application etc etc. it's just awful.the front camera is virtually unusable in low light and not really passable in good daylight. again, colours are all over the place, noise fills the image, and there is a distinct lack of definition.the built in speaker is mono, which isn't an issue, but it's quite blare'y and jarring on the ears!it does have nfc built in though and some other good features and the size of the display is good and it comes with a case.i would suggest if you intend to take photos to retain for posterity of events, locations, friends, and family, you should give this a strong miss! if you want to use it to view images like photos or videos, again, give it a miss, and if you want to listen to anything without headphones, give it a miss.if your use case is a large screen, you want to use google pay, you only read the news or look at facebook/twitter on it, and don't intend to use the camera for anything than maybe capturing the gas meter reading and have no interest in youtube, netflix, or prime video etc, and any music/audio you listen to via headphones, this may still be viable. if not, my advice is steer well clear.i organised a return to amazon the following morning and have bought a motorola for a bit more money that i hope will be a significant improvement (i'd be amazed if any other mobile phone could fail as spectacularly to deliver as the ulefone!)

avis_text: immense deception je reposais tous mes espoirs sur ce mobile, je l'ai attendu depuis des mois et au final il s'avere que c est une catastrophe, les tests de certains sites sont completements faux ou alors ils ont trop peu utilises le produit pour veritablement le juger.c est de la folie de pretendre ce telephone comme le roi du monde de l autonomie alors qu au final il surchauffe autant que n importe quel xperia et la batterie chute autant que n importe quel autre xperia !c est au dela du marketing, ca devient de la publicite mensongere.a peine 1h30 de navigation internet, deux appels telephoniques et l'installation de quelques applications, que le telephone est deja bouillant avec 20% de batterie en moins ! quel gaspillage je vais irrevocablement le retourner et conserver le xperia 10 iii.le xperia 10 iii est nettement plus endurant contrairement aux tests, l'inconvenient c est que le 10 iii a un processeur inutilisable tellement il fonctionne au ralenti, alors que faire ?sans compter qu'il n'y a meme pas de 4k, que le son d'enregistrement des micros est ridicule, le port usb est 2.0 et que les bordures du telephone ne sont meme pas bien collees, en plastique en plus et qu'il y a toujours autant d'applications inutiles du systeme impossible a desinstaller, mon dieu que ca fait mal !

avis_text: i have to say that overall the phone is a good phone, but on the first two weeks you could get the wish to return, as i had. battery was lasting less than one day, and i was really upset about. but i tried to find an online solution, and i got it. i have calibrate the battery. how? charge 100%, use until 0% and when the phone turn off, leave there for 4 hours. so you charge again 100% and use it. with a normal use i got one day and half battery life, and it was satisfying me, even if not impressing at all. i was expecting at least two days at least, but whenever is getting ok for one day using a lot like gaming, or bluetooth, or camera, it is ok. for sure the great advantage is that you can get it charger in 17 minutes, and it makes everything easier. hope this can be helpfull for whom are thinking to buy it

avis_text: i had to get something cheap after losing my iphone 12 pro, after some extensive googling i opted on the poco m4 pro. overall a great phone, it's quick and a lot more accessible than an apple phone. i play mobile games on it with no issues and runs all social media with ease. my only issues are with the speakers and the camera , the speakers are quite quiet. i used to be able to listen to podcasts clearly in the shower but now i can't hear the podcasts over the water. the camera takes some nice pictures, but i also get a lot of blurry ones too. overall well worth the price though

avis_text: great phone to slowly introduce the older generation to smart phones let's them have both options of touch screen and buttons. a few apps included not too much to overwhelm them. only problem i'm finding is the phone doesn't ring very long! i'm having to ring my mum several times for her to be able to answer before it stops ringing but if i ring her on whatsapp it rings as long as i am willing to wait. manual doesn't give any option to show how to lengthen the caller incoming call. on the whole it's a fab little phone and my mums 84 and took no time to get used to it. she's never used an app or had internet but she's loving it and loving the video calling on whatsapp. because the phone looks like her previous old phone it's gave her confidence to use the phone using both buttons and touchscreen and not feel worried to make a mistake.

titre_produit: T√©l√©phone Portable Debloqu√© Ulefone Note 13P, Cam√©ra Arri√®re 20MP, Cam√©ra Frontale 16MP, G35 2,3GHz 4Go+64Go, Smartphone Dual SIM 4G, Ecran FHD+ 6,5 '', Fente pour 3 Cartes, Android 11, NFC Bleu
avis_text: after a few hours of transferring over the setup (apps etc) from my old phone (cubot x30) to the ulefone note 13, i took it for a run through its paces.performance wise i think it's pretty decent and fairly snappy. however, the display seemed completely off in terms of the colour accuracy. i don't think it can render red - every red tone was displayed as vibrant/burnt orange. i compared the screen to my cubot and it seemed completely washed out and devoid of any contrast or colour depth.i next tried the cameras. these are abysmal, absolutely abysmal. phones from nearly a decade ago deliver better pictures. the main reason for buying the ulefone over others was that it has sony image sensors. as a well trusted/established brand known for their reasonably good quality lenses and sensors, i was expected much more than the mushy undefined poor quality images that the camera produces.it's almost as if someone has smeared vaseline over the lens - no definition, lots of noise in the image, abysmal colour saturation and depth, absolutely horrible.just to qualify my reference points, my cubot x30 is significantly better (just being replaced as it's a bit unreliable now) and prior to that i've had phones in the ¬£80-¬£150 price range from cubot, xiaomi, and oukitel etc. going back through photo's i'd taken 8 years prior, it was clear that despite having a higher pixel count and also being so much newer, the quality of image and screen is shockingly poor and worse than products nearly a decade older!i transferred the images to my laptop so i could ensure it wasn't just a case of the shockingly bad display screen with wildly inaccurate colour rendering that was the issue, and no - it wasn't, it's clearly the camera/lens/sensor. i've tried various different settings from decreasing the pixel count to applying filters, invoking the ai capability of the photo application etc etc. it's just awful.the front camera is virtually unusable in low light and not really passable in good daylight. again, colours are all over the place, noise fills the image, and there is a distinct lack of definition.the built in speaker is mono, which isn't an issue, but it's quite blare'y and jarring on the ears!it does have nfc built in though and some other good features and the size of the display is good and it comes with a case.i would suggest if you intend to take photos to retain for posterity of events, locations, friends, and family, you should give this a strong miss! if you want to use it to view images like photos or videos, again, give it a miss, and if you want to listen to anything without headphones, give it a miss.if your use case is a large screen, you want to use google pay, you only read the news or look at facebook/twitter on it, and don't intend to use the camera for anything than maybe capturing the gas meter reading and have no interest in youtube, netflix, or prime video etc, and any music/audio you listen to via headphones, this may still be viable. if not, my advice is steer well clear.i organised a return to amazon the following morning and have bought a motorola for a bit more money that i hope will be a significant improvement (i'd be amazed if any other mobile phone could fail as spectacularly to deliver as the ulefone!)

titre_produit: Xiaomi Redmi Note 11 - Smartphone 128GB, 4GB RAM, Dual Sim, Twilight Blue
avis_text: if you're looking for a phone and don't want to spend more than ¬£200, this is a good option.i bought this phone to replace a 3 year old huawei that i had, and after a week of use, i'm loving it so far.the best feature is the display; effectively 1080p and amoled, so the display is sharp and colours pop well, plus you get very deep blacks which can save on battery.the display is nice and big, i've read some reviews saying the bezels are big; i think that's subjective and reflects what you're used to. for me the bezels are fine, particularly when you have the case on (provided in the box)for the battery, i'm able to comfortably get 2 days of use w/o charging (i mainly do internet browsing/messaging)the performance is fast enough, has a fingerprint sensor on the power button that works well (bring right handed i use it with my thumb), plus the phone, in the uk anyway, comes with nfc. i was able to use google pay in shops with no problems.i'm not much of a photographer, so can't really comment on the camera, but if a camera is important, either you need to spend more or use the money you saved from buying a flagship, and buy a dslr camera.overall, i'm a happy customer

avis_text: after a few hours of transferring over the setup (apps etc) from my old phone (cubot x30) to the ulefone note 13, i took it for a run through its paces.performance wise i think it's pretty decent and fairly snappy. however, the display seemed completely off in terms of the colour accuracy. i don't think it can render red - every red tone was displayed as vibrant/burnt orange. i compared the screen to my cubot and it seemed completely washed out and devoid of any contrast or colour depth.i next tried the cameras. these are abysmal, absolutely abysmal. phones from nearly a decade ago deliver better pictures. the main reason for buying the ulefone over others was that it has sony image sensors. as a well trusted/established brand known for their reasonably good quality lenses and sensors, i was expected much more than the mushy undefined poor quality images that the camera produces.it's almost as if someone has smeared vaseline over the lens - no definition, lots of noise in the image, abysmal colour saturation and depth, absolutely horrible.just to qualify my reference points, my cubot x30 is significantly better (just being replaced as it's a bit unreliable now) and prior to that i've had phones in the ¬£80-¬£150 price range from cubot, xiaomi, and oukitel etc. going back through photo's i'd taken 8 years prior, it was clear that despite having a higher pixel count and also being so much newer, the quality of image and screen is shockingly poor and worse than products nearly a decade older!i transferred the images to my laptop so i could ensure it wasn't just a case of the shockingly bad display screen with wildly inaccurate colour rendering that was the issue, and no - it wasn't, it's clearly the camera/lens/sensor. i've tried various different settings from decreasing the pixel count to applying filters, invoking the ai capability of the photo application etc etc. it's just awful.the front camera is virtually unusable in low light and not really passable in good daylight. again, colours are all over the place, noise fills the image, and there is a distinct lack of definition.the built in speaker is mono, which isn't an issue, but it's quite blare'y and jarring on the ears!it does have nfc built in though and some other good features and the size of the display is good and it comes with a case.i would suggest if you intend to take photos to retain for posterity of events, locations, friends, and family, you should give this a strong miss! if you want to use it to view images like photos or videos, again, give it a miss, and if you want to listen to anything without headphones, give it a miss.if your use case is a large screen, you want to use google pay, you only read the news or look at facebook/twitter on it, and don't intend to use the camera for anything than maybe capturing the gas meter reading and have no interest in youtube, netflix, or prime video etc, and any music/audio you listen to via headphones, this may still be viable. if not, my advice is steer well clear.i organised a return to amazon the following morning and have bought a motorola for a bit more money that i hope will be a significant improvement (i'd be amazed if any other mobile phone could fail as spectacularly to deliver as the ulefone!)

avis_text: i upgraded to this phone from an old samsung s7 edge. the s7 i had owned since 2016 and the battery started to degrade slowly over the years which is normal on all smart phones. i was looking at other brands but decided to stick with samsung as that's what i knew.the samsung a52 5g is for me a perfect phone, i didn't really care too much about the under the hood specs as i am not a gamer but was mostly after a good camera and i am pleased to say this deliveres and some.overall battery life is excellent and lasts 2 days without needing to charge, this includes quite a bit of screen on time. finger print reader is always snappy and never have any noticable slow downs.excellent phone and happy with the upgrade over my older s7.

avis_text: ich habe mich auf die r√ºckkehr von honor sehr gefreut. mir hat die software, das design der handys und die gute update politik ( im gegensatz zum xiaomi) immer gefallen. hier habe ich mich extrem auf die kamera gefreut und wurde sehr entt√§uscht....aber erstmal von vorne.das design ist absolute sahne. das handy ist leicht, liegt toll in der hand und die abgerundeten ecken geben ein premium gef√ºhl. √ºber die verarbeitung kann ich ebenso nichts negatives √§u√üern.das display ist scharf, fl√ºssig und sehr kontrastreich. die 120 herz sind sp√ºrbar, aber auch im akkuverbrauch. hier erreiche ich soc von 6 stunden. dank der 66 watt ist das handy jedoch schnell aufgeladen. was noch erw√§hnt werden sollte, ist dass netlix nur in sd abgespielt wird...der weitere kritikpunkt ist der verbaute monolautsprecher. bitte nicht falsch verstehen. dieser ist laut und gut, aber stereo ist deutlich angehmer.und nun zur kamera : die 8mp weitwinkel kamera ist nur bei sehr guten lichtverh√§ltnissen okay. sonst ist es nur eine spielerei die nicht ernstgenommen werden kann. so wie die restlichen 2 mp kameras. die 108mp schiessen gute bis sehr gute fotos bei gutem tageslicht. jedoch ist das ein oder andere foto in den ecken unscharf. und mit dem neuen update wurde dieses problem nicht behoben. werden die lichtverh√§ltnisse schlechter, merkt man starkes bildrauschen und viel unsch√§rfe. der nacht modus kann einiges rausholen, aber es ist nicht das was man fr√ºher von honor oder huawei erwarten konnte. diese waren schlie√ülich der spitzenreiter in dieser kategorie.im moment m√∂chte ich noch kein abschlie√üendes urteil f√§llen, aber in der preisklasse hat honor eine starke konkurrenz vor sich, die zum teil auch billiger sind (zb. oneplus nord 2).honor sollte schnellstm√∂glich updates rausbringen die die kamera verbessern.ansonsten wird es f√ºr honor schwer sein zur√ºckzukehren.edit: preis ist f√ºr die gebotene leistung zu hoch. ein angemessener preis w√§re 399‚Ç¨.

avis_text: habia comprado antes un moto g30. tras analisar varias comparativas, y tenerlos en mano a ambos.prefiero el moto g31, os explico porque:- primero, es un movil para mi mujer. es super importancia el factor dimensiones y peso. los ultimos a√±os han crecido y engordado mucho por las pantallas y baterias. el g31 destaca a su antecesor por ser 20g m√°s contenido (180g), y tambien mas ergonomico, por un mejor aprovechamiento de pantalla.gracias motorola por escuchar a tus usuarios- segundo, la estrellla de la fiesta es la pantalla. se ha tenido que sacrificar mucho, pero ha merecido la pantalla sobretodo cuando comparas con el g30. es normal que le gane, porque los negros, los colores se notan mucho m√°s. salvo si no te gustan colores mas llamativo , te va a gustar. los angulos de vision son mucho mejores, es m√°s nitida (fhd), aunque solo tiene 60hz. pero no te preocupes, porque realmente ir√° igualmente fluido.- si tienes en cuenta que la pantalla es todo, porque es donde ir√°s visualizar tu contenido, entonces si ha sido un cambio importante- camara de 50mp. no te creas en los numeros. las comparativas tanto el g30 como el g31 hacen fotos muy buenas sempre y cuando hay buenas condiciones de luz. como todos los moviles a este rango de precio, cuando la luz flaquea, logico que tendr√° m√°s ruido. pero para fotos casuales, para redes sociales es perfecta!mejorableandroid 11 - lleva el mismo android que el g30, y solo tendra una actualizacion. deberia a estas alturas salir con android 12, encima cuando en verano saldra android 13. mala decision, encima cuando solo tiene una actualizacion de sistema.- el sensor de huellas. se cambio a lateral, puede o no gustarte, eso si el trasero del moto g30 iba mejor. habra que acostumbrarse, como todo. tenedlo en cuenta.- carga rapida. podria perfectamente incluir 15w, pero solo incluye 10w. no es critico pero si tenemos en cuenta que el g30 tenia 20w. ojo, porque las pruebas dicen que en una carga de 0 a 100, el g30 gana por 15 min de diferencia.saldra el g41, que es el mismo movil pero con mejor carga rapida 33w y camara con estabilizador optico. pero en lugar de los 199‚Ç¨ (169‚Ç¨ en promo) valdr√° 269 ‚Ç¨. no se hasta que punto compensa, bajo mi punto de vista, no.es muy buen movil y mi mujer est√° encantada.

avis_text: premetto che la mia recensione avviene dopo 1 settimana buona di uso intenso del dispositivo, provengo da 3 anni di samsung galaxy s10+ che dopo averlo spremuto al massimo costantemente ogni singolo giorno tra giochi, applicazioni varie e lavoro ha deciso di abbandonarmi.nel complesso lo smartphone √® ottimo, scattante fluido e davvero ma davvero veloce e reattivo ma qui casca l'asino...dopo varie recensioni e pareri di esperti abbiamo scoperto che il software dello xiaomi 12 ha per impostazione di fabrica una limitazione al processore che al minimo accenno di temperature a stento tiepide tende a limitarne le prestazioni sia per evitare che il dispositivo diventi bollente, sia per salvaguardare la vita dello stesso allora la domanda mi giunge spontanea: che senso ha avere il top dei processori, l'ultimo modello all'avanguardia se al primo accenno di temperature alte (ma in realt√† nel mio caso parliamo di "appena tiepido" ) non dico un ora di uso intenso ma appena 15/20 minuti devo vedere il gioco o il video a scatti annullando di conseguenza anche la fluidit√† a 120hz del display (ottimo a mio avviso) rendendo di fatto lo smartphone si un top di gamma ma solo per 20 minuti circa?se valutiamo tramite software lo snapdragon precedente dello xiaomi 11t pro o del galaxy s21 fe notiamo che √® leggermente meno prestante ma il processore resta stabile senza limitazioni e di conseguenza rende il processore pi√π vecchio pi√π prestante nel lungo periodo.sono fuori per lavoro, la prima cosa che far√≤ appena rientro √® renderlo perch√© per me questa √® una presa per i fondelli.

avis_text: immense deception je reposais tous mes espoirs sur ce mobile, je l'ai attendu depuis des mois et au final il s'avere que c est une catastrophe, les tests de certains sites sont completements faux ou alors ils ont trop peu utilises le produit pour veritablement le juger.c est de la folie de pretendre ce telephone comme le roi du monde de l autonomie alors qu au final il surchauffe autant que n importe quel xperia et la batterie chute autant que n importe quel autre xperia !! c est au dela du marketing, ca devient de la publicite mensongere.a peine 1h30 de navigation internet, deux appels telephoniques et l'installation de quelques applications que le telephone est deja bouillant avec 20% de batterie en moins ! quel gaspillage je vais irrevoquablement le retourner et conserver le xperia 5 ii qui a exactement la meme autonomie et la meme chauffe.le xperia 10 iii est nettement plus endurant contrairement aux tests, l'inconvenient c est que le 10 iii a un processeur innutilisable tellement il fonctionne au ralenti, alors que faire ? le xperia 5 ii a l'air d'avoir une meilleure autonomie que ce 10 iv donc aucun interet de le garder.sans compter qu'il n'y a meme pas de 4k, que le son d'enregistrement des micros est ridicule, le port usb est 2.0 et que les bordures du telephone ne sont meme pas bien collees et qu'il y a toujours autant d'applications inutiles du systeme impossible a desinstaller, mon dieu que ca fait mal !
